de.fu_berlin.maniac.network_manager

Class TwoHopNeighbour

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fu_berlin.maniac.network_manager.TwoHopNeighbour

  • public class TwoHopNeighbour
extends java.lang.Object
    A 2-hop neighbour is a node that is reachable in 2 or less hops from this node.
    Author:
    maniacchallenge

    • Constructor Summary

      TwoHopNeighbour(java.net.InetAddress iadd, java.lang.Boolean sym, java.net.InetAddress hop)

    • Constructor Detail

      • TwoHopNeighbour

        public TwoHopNeighbour(java.net.InetAddress iadd,
               java.lang.Boolean sym,
               java.net.InetAddress hop)
        Parameters:
        iadd - The Inetaddress of the 2-hop neighbour. A 2-Hop neighbour is any node that is reachable via max. 2 hops. That means that links also count as 2-hop neighbours!
        sym - Indicates if this link is symmetric, i.e. if the neighbour also 'sees' you in the network
        hop - The Inetaddress of the node between this node and the two hop neighbour
